review: At first I was a little skeptical about using this wondering how could any company offer you a payment plan without charging you any interest but after completely paying off my first purchase without any hidden charges or fees I strongly recommend this app if you prefer to make large purchases hurt less by breaking it down to four payments. Your payments are due every two weeks, you make your first payment at the time of purchase and then three additional beginning two weeks after your purchase. If you are wondering how they make any money out of this is because they add one dollar to each of your payments ($4 total) or at least that‚Äôs how much it was for me considering they don‚Äôt pull a credit check I can‚Äôt see them charging more or less based on your credit so I am assuming it‚Äôs the same for everyone.
title: Awesome app

review:
This is a solid option for those who want to spread out how they pay for things over a short period of time. You start out with a certain limit, the price for using QuadPay is usually $4 plus the price of your order. The app allows you to account for taxes and other fees. There are a great number of brands/stores that support the use of QuadPay, (like ebay, my personal favorite).

The app is pretty straightforward, often updated and pretty dependable. They could do a better job with being able to access the card information to make your purchase if you have to close the app. As it is now, if you close the app after securing your financing, you can‚Äôt get back to it the second time.

This app is useful and comes in the clutch! Everyone should give them a try!
title: Great option to pay for things without breaking the bank!

review: I literally pulled up to the gas station, and looked at my bank account and seen I don‚Äôt have much (20$) to get what I was hoping for in gas (45$). Well deserved review for a great app and more so for the help Quadpay has been thus far with helping with not just purchasing clothes and shoes, but essentials like Gas! When I tell you I was hurting to spend that 20$ but looked at the app as God moved in me to say to myself, ‚ÄúLet me see if QuadPay is acceptable through ApplePay so that I may use a digital card if possible. ü§©ü§© to my surprise the transaction was approved and I was able to get the payment split into 4 which left me with money in my account and not broke. review:
The concept is good, the execution in the mobile app is deeply flawed. Do not attempt to use the app to purchase from a retailer that QuadPay does not have a direct integration with. It‚Äôs glitchy, loops your purchase and will leave you with multiple pending holds and charges to your card until they fully process the payment. 

This just happened to me, rather than just charging me my first installment, they charged me and then placed four additional separate holds for my other installments. This was due to purchasing through the app and it glitching. So bottom line, they held an amount on my credit card for 25% more than if I had simply bought it up front. Customer service is pretty slick, but when you get past the apologies the reality is they are telling you, even though it‚Äôs their mistake and the apps shortcomings, you won‚Äôt have access to your money for 10 days. 

Until they fix this or offer better customer support, I really encourage you to look at other installment solutions. Dang, I had high hopes for these guys but the customer service failed me.
title: BEWARE of using this app

review:

I loved this kind of concept where you have a set of 4 payments over a certain time  period which also make it easier especially for other people to shop without the hassle of breaking their budget.
Another thing that i love with it is that i don't have the need to use a credit card for my own personal needs due to a higher interests rates that comes with it.
Over all this is a keeper that i hope to use for a long period of time & be able to build a great relationship as a client.

Put your mind at ease and money tightness behind you with amazing app and company!   No insane interest charges and no hidden troubles, just straight forward pay in 4 installments one payment now and then every 2 weeks.  With the ability to use this most places online , it‚Äôs a life saver!  
       I have already used this several times and it‚Äôs fun and easy!  Go to the site in the app and get items or pay bills as QuadPay creates a card just for you for the amount you need and get what you want.  The app automatically charges your payment method so you don‚Äôt have to worry about remembering to make the payments manually. review:
**Update

Today the app reduced my available balance by $50. I currently have no open orders and have always paid on-time or early. Why would QuadPay decrease my spending limit?

I went online to purchase a few pairs of shoes from my favorite shoe brand. There was a Black Friday sale going on and I didn‚Äôt want to pass it up. When I was ready to ‚Äúcheck-out‚Äù and pay, QuadPay was offered as an option. This was my 1st time hearing about QuadPay but I trusted the shoe brand so I decided to give it a try.  QuadPay divides your total balance due into 4 easy payments. There is no interest, no strings attached. It‚Äôs completely hassle free. I received an email confirmation, text confirmation and it even synced reminder payments with my phone calendar. After paying off my 1st purchase with QuadPay, I decided to try the app. I signed in and it had my order history already there. I love QuadPay. Thank you! So much more convenient than a Credit Card.
title: Convenient. Easy. No Strings.

review: This app is easy to use and great when you want to buy something from all known brands stores and don‚Äôt have all the money to purchase what you want. This app is easy and simple you create a profile then you start searching from thousands of very known brands Gucci and all those high end items and names you love to shop at. Simple steps you choose from the huge list of stores you add item to cart and it will ask to add a debt or credit card it‚Äôs only used for the small partial payment you will need to pay and I mean small like less then 50 and it will save the card on your profile and deduct the remaining payments every other week intel you pay off your balance. It‚Äôs credit with out the credit check. It‚Äôs fun easy and simple with thousands of great store options to choose from.
title: Great App

review:
I‚Äôve used QuadPay twice now and I find it easy to use and a great alternative for those of us who do not want credit cards.

The first time I used it was for a last minute request by my daughter for Fashion Nova. You can choose QuadPay during checkout with them and it couldn‚Äôt be simpler.

The second time I used it was for an emergency need for a new bed frame. This time I went to the QuadPay app and searched for the store I wanted (IKEA) and it took me to the website and checkout process that way. I knew from previously checking that during checkout on the IKEA website that they do not list any of the 3rd party payment apps so that bummed me out until I realized I could checkout through QuadPays interface instead. Initially it was a little clunky but I figured it out and will probably use it regularly  so I can keep my credit cards for true emergencies.
title: Good credit card alternative

developerResponse: {'id': 16342355, 'body': 'Thanks for the love and keep on #QuadPaying!  üíñ', 'modified': '2020-07-01T16:41:58Z'}

I don‚Äôt plan on making huge purchases or a purchase I can‚Äôt afford anyway, so this is so great for the little things I want but have anxiety about dropping $100 or little more. My only con:

I‚Äôm not quite sure how the spending balance goes up but I hope it does go up to at least $500 as I feel more comfortable spending. I wish that were better explained but honestly I‚Äôm just happy for what it does for my financially induced anxiety.

review:
I downloaded the app, put in my info and got denied. The app only requests basic info, not your social or anything like that. I reached out to support via email(which is the only way to get a human response) to see why I did not get approved. I was advised that they do not disclose their criteria to prevent fraud. Hmm... this made absolutely no sense to me, if I provided my information I have a right to know why I cannot use the service, for all I know the denial could be based on someone else fraudulently using my information but I can‚Äôt dispute or address it b/c they won‚Äôt disclose it to me. This app is bull!!

Got a bogus response to my review, basically stating that they can‚Äôt approve everyone. In which I understand, that‚Äôs how any company with an approval process works, however that is not my concern. My question is why didn‚Äôt I get approved and what is the approval based on?! review: Among their competitors, (which I have all used/ tried out) , so far transactions and functions feel more person in terms of customer experience, instead of lead by a random algorithm like others. review: I love this app. The one thing about quad pay that always bugged me was that you could only use it at participating stores. Now I can shop anywhere I want to, which is a huge improvement. There is one quirk that was a bit frustrating. You can shop in 100 dollar increments and must essentially predict how much you are going to spent. After choosing 100 dollars I bought something that, with tax and shipping, went about 8 dollars. I figured I would simply be able to make up the difference by paying the 8 dollars up front and then splitting the rest into 25 dollar increments. But I actually had to go back to the start and choose 200 from quad pay. Despite this, I still gave the app five stars because I am no longer limited to certain stores when using quad pay.

I absolutely love this app. I will always recommend this if there‚Äôs something you really have your eyes set on or a bill that got out of hand it can be an absolute Godsend. Just don‚Äôt abuse it and buy responsibly. This helps you stay in budget so don‚Äôt put yourself in a spot you can‚Äôt pay every two weeks. 

The interface is simple and clean. May take a bit to load but it‚Äôs no big deal. Instructions are simple. My advice though with it, if your worried about being short before your next pay day. Make sure you buy an item on pay day. That‚Äôs a lot of stress gone that way I know for a fact the money is there.
title: This is a game changer

review:
I was honestly skeptical about apps like this, lending money digitally with no fees, but after using this app for a few months I absolutely would recommend it.
It‚Äôs honestly made me more willing to make purchases on things because spreading out a $100 cost into 4 $25 payments or 2 $50 payments makes things easier and less stressful on your budget. 
The new ability to pay bills such as Verizon or Comcast is extremely helpful. 
Obviously the downside is if you don‚Äôt pay back on time or commit fried there‚Äôs an issue, but with all lending the rules are the same, only borrow what you can afford to pay back.
Honestly this is a great financial tool for not just Christmas shopping, but for monthly expenses that pop up, luxury purchases or any other small expense.
title: Great app for light shopping

review: I have been using Quad Pay for a few months now on a few different purchases, such as Old Navy and Apple. The way this service is set up is much different then the other pay over time services. Others are website specific and some even charge interest. This can be used at any retailer and even in person as long as Apple Pay is accepted. That level of convenience has led me to use this more and more. The fee is only $1 dollar per pay period which is minimal. I recommend this to anyone looking to budget their money better because this allows you to be able to make larger purchases without breaking your bank in one purchase. I am glad to have stumbled upon this and will be a forever user of it now!
title: The best out of all pay over time services

I‚Äôm glad for the app. It gave me like an $300 credit which is awesome! You even double check that the order was completed and update any funds that were supposed to be added or that were not used. Best app I‚Äôve come across in quite some time!! 5 starsssss!
title: Fast , easy, secure!

review: I am new to QuadPay. I love this new concept but I think a few things could be a improved within this App. I experienced a problem when the merchant I was purchasing from was open at the same time it was open on QuadPay. When I checked out, my debit card was charged twice; the full amount of my purchase and the QuadPay initial payment simultaneously. Imagine the horror! Luckily, I was able to cancel the wrong payment and be fully refunded. Then I closed the outside App and processed the purchase with the merchant on QuadPay. Confusing right? I definitely won‚Äôt do that again, but it would have been helpful if this had been mentioned somewhere in the Quadpay user instructions. I had not experienced this problem before with similar Apps. Other than that‚ÄîI‚Äôm still hooked!
title: New to Quadpay

review: I really needed to buy some clothing for this event, but I‚Äôve been struggling with money the past couple weeks. I took some time off work without pay and just got back to full time two weeks ago. I didn‚Äôt have the full amount I needed to pay (without going broke) and I get paid until next week - too late. Then my cousin said I can get the clothing through QuadPay and pay back in four equal payments. I was able to buy what I needed and only paid a quarter of the price that day. My package is getting here tomorrow and my second payment is next week. I also used it to buy Christmas presents. I got an Apple Watch for my brother and only paid $55 that day! The watch was ready for pick up that same day. Just went to my local Apple store to pick it up. I love this app!

review: Despite never missing a payment in the over-a-year period I‚Äôve used the app, QuadPay suddenly dropped my available balance from $250 to $50. review: Quad pay is a brilliant little app that I found out about when checking out at a store I don‚Äôt usually frequent. Basically you put your info into the app and it tells you the limit you have. You receive a virtual card number to check out with making it a quick and efficient checkout process. The app then breaks down how much you actually purchase into four payments with the first payment due the day of purchase, your remaining payments are spaced out over the next few weeks. I love that it took a purchase that was going to be a larger hit to my budget and made it much easier to manage. The no added fees were such a huge deal. And you can pay ahead which frees up the funds towards a new purchase. So far I‚Äôm loving it.
title: Quite brilliant

You can‚Äôt talk to real people not by text, email, OR PHONE (they don‚Äôt even have a number you can call) you can only talk to a Bot and then WAIT FOR WEEKS until (hopefully) they finally reach out to you. I have been in waitlist for over a dozen of times and each time I get to wait number 20 or so it sends me to the back of the line, Absolutely Ridiculous!! I got a virtual card for the EXACT amount for my purchase only for two items to go through on that card and they still expect me to pay the amount I didn‚Äôt even use!! Please save yourself the stress, especially during these troubling times. I recommend using Affirm or Klarna I have never had any problem with either of them.

review:
So we‚Äôve all seen something shiny on a website, and thought I wish I could afford it. 

You could spend your entire paycheck, or a great portion of your check buying that new toy, or maybe even a necessity, but what are you sacrificing to get it? 

Thanks to this app, there is no sacrificing. It breaks the overall price into 4 payments. It was so easy to use. The item I wanted wasn‚Äôt with an affiliated retailer on their app which is so easy to navigate. Through the app I searched the company I was looking to buy from, and it popped up. I searched the item I wanted, and it still offered me the chance to pay with QuadPay. 

I was nervous that since it wasn‚Äôt affiliated that it may not work, but it asked me how much my item was, and even asked if it should add tax. If you over guess the amount you‚Äôre buying, it‚Äôs fine. The system just charges you for what you spent. It‚Äôs the coolest concept that I‚Äôve seen. 

The app works effortlessly creating a temporary prepaid spending card that you copy and paste into the checkout process. It was over and done in  seconds. 

I highly recommend them! Especially if you‚Äôve tried Klarna, or affirm. This app is so much better.

review: I have always been a person if I had to pay a lot at one time that meant I really didn‚Äôt need it, so I would never purchase anything at least anything that was worth buying I would settle for the no name brand items. I always couldn‚Äôt wait until September for layaway to start for the holiday season. Now it‚Äôs no waiting I have it at my fingertips and I‚Äôm loving it especially the many merchants that you can purchase from I suggest this site to anyone on a budget and feel they can‚Äôt afford nice things, now you can. Enjoy this new buying power I am. Before I forget after your first payment unlike layaway which is held until you finish paying here your items are shipped right away yay! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
title: Shopping for me will never be the same again!

review: Honestly the negative reviews crack me up.  Generally it‚Äôs someone complaining about something so absolutely absurd or insignificant.  They essentially front you money.... your bank is gonna hit you with a bigger ‚Äúfee‚Äù than that $4.  Returns with these apps will always be messy... common sense.  Again they are fronting you money, yet here you are complaining that it‚Äôs not enough.  I researched a bit before deciding to do it and come to find out they are doing business exactly like they say they will on their website... shocking how if you read about things you know where the bar for expectations should be set.  No need to knock off ‚Äústars‚Äù because they are doing exactly what they promise but you just don‚Äôt like it or think it‚Äôs fair.  Shame.
title: So simple.

review:
I've successfully used quadpay twice now, once online at checkout and  once via the app. I accomplished my tasks both times, but had a little bit of learning curve on the app. They could take a look at apps by Klara or Affirm. All in all, though, I was satisfied with the process and happy they were out there to facilitate my purchase. The only major barrier for me is the biweekly payroll based payments. For those of us who are paid monthly, Affirm works better. Just a thought. Thanks for being there, QuadPay!

As for those claiming fradulent practices, please back off. This is very straightforward, and any newbie glitches deserve the benefit of the doubt, not instant malignment. Give them a chance to correct any good faith errors.
title: Good start; minor tweaks as user base grows will be helpful.

review:
So for people wondering what‚Äôs the catch...there isn‚Äôt one honestly lol you sign up, they give you a line of credit, add a debit card, pay your 1st of 4 payments upfront then every 2 weeks you make a payment, when everything is paid back you get a limit increase. This app has really come in clutch for me. They just add on a $4 service fee for every purchase. Not bad lol. 
I love this app and really have no complaints about it. One thing I think you guys should do is have the option for people to get a QuadPay debit/pay card for in-store purchases, because not everyone uses Google/Applepay, they do the same process (select a amount they want to use),and then... BAM! It‚Äôs right there on the QuadPay card for immediate use!
title: This is amazing!!

review: By far if you‚Äôd asked me a month ago most likely would‚Äôve had max stars and positive feedback. The customer service is by far the worst, I have sent multiple chats and emails prior to Mother‚Äôs Day and have yet to receive a response. Monitor your account. I have an unauthorized purchase from a store that I‚Äôd never order from. For one I can‚Äôt tell you anything pertaining to golf or any associated with it. $434 at that, in which I‚Äôm confused to how this happened and to how my account has changed my telephone number to which I can‚Äôt edit, also the card used is not mines. So I have sent multiple messages asking for the status to see if this has been deleted, and to have my account checked or deleted. No response! I have since tried the reach out through chat and again no response. My concern is that i canceled the order and wanted that checked on, also need my account placed back in good standing that I established the correct way.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review:
I submitted a payment on Friday when I got paid. It wasn‚Äôt due til Monday but I wanted to make sure I didn‚Äôt forget. When my payment wasn‚Äôt added to my account by Sunday, I sent an email. I received no reply. Monday I received an email reminding me my payment was due. Tuesday I was charged a $7 late fee. I sent an email with my bank statement showing where the money was taken out of my account. I finally received a reply when I messaged them via twitter. They claimed that they tried to charge me twice and both were rejected due to ‚Äúinsufficient funds‚Äù. I sent the photo of my bank statement AGAIN and still have not heard a reply. They removed the late fee but have not posted my payment. There is no phone number to call. They do not respond to emails. How can you run a business that deals with money and NOT have a phone number for people to call in issues. This is such a poorly managed company. 
TRY KLARNA it‚Äôs so much better. I‚Äôve never had any issues with Klarna.
title: No way to contact anyone

review: I saw an advertisement about this app and after much consideration gave it a try on a purchase. It puts your purchase in four payments due bi weekly with the first payment going towards your purchase the time of purchase. The best part is you don‚Äôt pay more than what adds up to the total price of your purchase. You can use it for online or in store purchases. Love that there is no accrual of interest. You use the digital card it gives you to make your purchase and the app stores uses your card to take payments from after in the following biweekly payments with no interest and no other hidden fees. There‚Äôs no credit check either. Very creative approach to buying, highly recommend!
title: Love it this is a much needed app!

review:
I ran out of contacts late last week and I‚Äôm not eligible again until October. In a panic, I searched for options that wouldn‚Äôt break the bank. Other apps that are similar either wouldn‚Äôt approve me or only had specific merchants. With QuadPay, I was able to find a website that had affordable lenses for me, and I used a ‚ÄúVirtual Card‚Äù to split my payments up over 4 biweekly payments! I‚Äôm so happy for QP! 

The only thing I noticed, and it‚Äôs not worth taking a star off is that you can‚Äôt ‚ÄúPay with PayPal‚Äù nor can you pay I‚Äôm another currency as I tried using it for a purchase that was in GBP, but would not go thru. Otherwise, I‚Äôm extremely happy and satisfied and hopefully those sorts of features can be added in the future!
title: So Thankful for QuadPay!

Once that is paid off your amount goes bak to $400 until it increases. I used this app to book my flight for California on Expedia i was happy to know that i didn‚Äôt have to pay it in full.

title: Great ! Convenient !!!!

review:
I really like this new app! 
One of the features I like the most about it is the ability to set limits on how much you would like to spend. I also love the search feature - to me, it makes finding stores/products less time-consuming. 
Another plus is, there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a spending minimum to take advantage of Quad Pay (it is my favorite plus thus far)!
My only complaint is that I would like to have a more in-depth breakdown of what I owe and when it is due. Through my exploration of the app, I‚Äôve found a basic overview of it, but I have not found a more detailed record. So, if the app does indeed feature something like this, perhaps make it easier to find.
Overall, I would say that Quad Pay (and the app itself) is a great idea and I‚Äôm pleased with it.
title: Cool app!

review: QuadPay is similar to other scheduled payment processors but better in the fact that it has more stores that I shop at on a regular basis, there is the option to purchase in store OR online at the same stores (unlike other processors), and you automatically know how much you have to spend before you shop. QuadPay issues you a ‚Äúcredit card‚Äù number to use for your purchase and it‚Äôs that simple!  I LOVE that they have ‚Äúeveryday‚Äù stores instead of stores I have never heard of.  This wonderful service certainly came in handy this Christmas season!  I will definitely use QuadPay again in the future on larger purchases when I don‚Äôt want to use my credit card which will incur interest charges.

review: Quadpay is the best! There are a few similar apps but quad pay is definitely the easiest to navigate. I have never had a single issue. You can even include overnight shipping. title: Love!

The app keeps track of when each payment is due and shopping through the app is very easy. You can shop online or in participating stores. I‚Äôve recently used the online shopping through the app to make another QuadPay purchase and I‚Äôll more than likely use this option more frequently. review: I was making a purchase through the Champs website and when I was checking out it gave me the option of paying with QuadPay. title: Quadpay is interest-free!!

review: Quad pay was the first payment plan service I had  used. Since I‚Äôve used them all but Quad Pay remains my favorite! I used to search around to find the stores that offer payments such as this but this app allows you to view all the stores that offer quad pay and now they even offer payments for all stores! In store and online! They approve you for an available shopping amount and you can choose ANY store, tell them how much you wish to spend of that available balance and they issue a temporary card number to use for that purchase and they break your buy up into payments! title: Use this app and regret nothing!

review:
I had moved a few times and I can‚Äôt seem to get my debit card linked with my correct billing address to allow me to purchase online using the only debit card that I have. review:
So I absolutely love the idea behind this app but believe their customer service needs so much work that it makes this app a complete turn off for me.

Let‚Äôs recap what happened. I placed an order with Guitar Center. Immediately after placing the order Guitar Center emailed and stated that the item they thought was in stock is not in stock. They gave me a number of options but I ultimately decided to cancel. 

Guitar center sent the cancellation email. I waited a few days before contacting quadpay as I noticed I did not get an email from them. In a similar experience with afterpay, afterpay contacted me as soon as the order was canceled to let me know that I will be receiving a refund and will no longer be charged for this order.

Anyhow, there is no phone number for Quadpay so I tried chat.. I was 200 in line.. it kept counting down and when i was 164 in line I got an error message in the app, immediately followed by email from quadpay saying sorry we missed your chat! Wait what? Your app glitched... anyhow, I decided to send an email. Attached a picture of the cancellation. It‚Äôs been a week and I have not heard a word back from this company.

I am just waiting to see if I am charged the next installment because then I will really flip. 

So again, the idea behind this is great but they need serious help with customer supports

review:
So let‚Äôs start with the fact that their customer service is basically nonexistent. If you reach out you will get an automated reply from a computer that might not even address your issue. I‚Äôve sent serval emails and the replies don‚Äôt solve my problem and I still can‚Äôt figure out how to get in touch with an actual person.

I‚Äôm being charged a late fee. 
 I had the money in my account but they said my card was declined. I used the exact same card I used for my initial payment. The automated reply I got about this issue said to contact my bank. Which I did and they said it was not an issue on their end. 
I also tried to make that payment early and it was reversed out of my account. 

Any other 4 equal payment will give you atleast 48 hours to a week to make your payment with no late fee. Quad pay gave me until midnight. But I didn‚Äôt get any type of assistance on their end to resolve my issue. 

Try literally any other service if you need to split your payment. Klarna can be used anywhere as well. Sezzle and Afterpay are nice too.

If I can ever get in touch with an actual person to cancel my late fee . Im paying my balance off in full and NEVER using this service again. Otherwise I guess I‚Äôll eat the late fee I shouldn‚Äôt have been charged in the first place and still never use this again.

review:
Pros: the A+ list of high end stores, love the app and keeps up with purchases. 

Cons: Paying in store with the app seems to be difficult for retailers. Another point is the instructions arent so clear on what you need to do in order for the Quad to work on a specific card through the app. iE making you copy paste the ‚Äúquadpay card‚Äù (which is just one of your cc cards) but if you happen to make a purchase at an online store once before they save your payment (info ie an old card.) so its a bit confusing on what card you will be paying Quad pay on. Simple platform issue.

The limit you can spend... $400?! That is not enough to start with given the selection of high end stores you can purchase from. Maybe this should vary person to person?

review: Everything on Quad Pay‚Äôs end was great. I found an item I wanted on a web site. I used a virtual card to buy it, made my first payment, and the item was shipped. Very easy and very satisfied with Quad Pay. On the other hand the item was shipped through Fed Ex and I got a text from them saying my item had been delivered, well it hasn‚Äôt. I still have not received my item three days after Fed Ex marked it as delivered. I had to open a case for missing item with Fed Ex. Who knows if or when I will get my item. Yet I still have to make payments to Quad Pay regardless if I get my item or not. It would be nice if Quad Pay had more communication with the shipping company to resolve issues like this.

review: Better than a credit card for sure. Cost a few bucks to use their service and for them to put their trust in you to make the payments seems more than fair to me! Once they fix their overall app experience this is most definitely a five star company. They do tend to start people out with a lower initial available credit compared to Afterpay but way more retailers take Quadpay so it‚Äôs a good trade off for me and once you complete all of your first four payments your available credit will most definitely go up.

review: I thought this was going to be a very simple app just like Afterpay. You do the installment plans no problem, WRONG. When you sign up, they collect info such as your birthday, your address, your email; you know just the basics. What they don‚Äôt tell you they run a test to see you qualify and afterward they let you know if you have been approved or not. Here is the thing, they don‚Äôt tell you why you haven‚Äôt been approved or what their qualifications are in order to get approved. So if you aren‚Äôt approved then you have to wait 30 days before you can try and shop or be apart AND on top of that once you are approved, you aren‚Äôt guaranteed to be approved for the next purchase you make. I prefer Afterpay because it‚Äôs simple and easy and you don‚Äôt have to meet any qualifications. They need to fix this and explain to their customers what they are signing up for.
title: BEFORE YOU SIGN UP

review: So basically I have been using this service for close to a year now, always on time with my payments, heck I even payed some payments earlier before. review:
I‚Äôve been a quadpay user for quite a while now, mainly just to help me afford my workout clothing addiction. I heard a while back that they were going to start a ‚Äúpay anywhere‚Äù feature. It wasn‚Äôt until I lost my job and started living off of shipt deliveries that I gave that part of the app a try though. 

Before I lost my job I always bought all my vitamins and protein powder at the same time, stocked up for the month. Now that I‚Äôm running out I was going to have to buy my vitamins this week- on this paycheck- and my protein powder next week -on that week‚Äôs paycheck. But then I remembered the quadpay anywhere feature and figured I‚Äôd give it a shot. 

I created the one time card, added it to my Apple Pay wallet, and was able to buy everything I needed in one shot versus making multiple trips to that store to gradually get what I needed. 

They do charge a $4 fee for that service but it‚Äôs definitely worth it in my opinion to not have to drive back out or make multiple purchases.

review: I had not been aware of the service, but it popped up when I placed an order, I checked it out, and found that I could make the purchase with it, in 4 equal payments, I had the funds to pay in full, but this allowed me to free those funds up for other things. I am excited to be able to use it again, I‚Äôve always had the money to pay for whatever I wanted, but this allows me to spread it out and keep a reserve for another day!   Love it, will use it!

review:

review:
This service is very handy when you just absolutely need an item for something important in your day to day functions..

As an Audio/Video Producer, I sometimes have to wait until I finish a project before a client will pay.. If I need to make a gear or software purchase in order to finish on time, QuadPay can possibly save the day... 
You actually become your own credit card company.. It‚Äôs almost like loaning yourself the funds you need, knowing ahead of time that you can pay yourself back in 4 payments.
The only thing I will complain about is that there are retailers out there with strange refund policies and blaming it on QP..
If you have to get refunded, don‚Äôt panic.. You have to stay on the payback schedule and as soon as your refund is cleared, you will see what ever you paid out, go right back in to your bank account.

review: So I tested out QuadPay and bought my first items. Bout 2 items from eBay. QuadPay gave me a disposable card information to help me thru my purchase. Not bad, I thought. However, a seller on eBay cancelled an order and sent a refund (don‚Äôt know why, tried contacting seller but I never asked for a refund) and since it was a disposable card information I will still be charged for using QuadPay and I will not be seeing a refund. My suggestion is that QuadPay should issue each person the same card information instead of changing it. That way If something happens, money can find its way back to an actual card instead of floating thru space and not seeing it again.

review: Great way to split up money! I have no complaints but need to share so you do not have the issue I had. I had $150 on the card to pay and my total was $200 at Target. review:
I, like many other shoppers out there, may feel hesitant to pay upfront a lot of money for shopping. Yes, there‚Äôs always the option of using credit cards, but unless you‚Äôre paying full balance each month, you‚Äôre paying interest on the balance.

QuadPay offers a way to get what you want, but spread out the payments without having to pay interest!

It would have been nice to have it all work in the app. That being said, it‚Äôs nothing their app designer couldn‚Äôt fix with some attentive care (and user testing haha). You‚Äôll get there!

Thanks for the service and helping me to afford a quality coat for the upcoming winter.

This type of inconsistency causes me to look at all the others(Klarna, Sezzle, AfterPay) now 1st before even considering QuadPay. Therefore, basically be very aware before you put all your eggs in this basket.

review:
I‚Äôm 98% sure that most of the 5 star reviews are fake. Ever since I downloaded quadpay it has been nothing but stressful. 

My first order, I went through the checkout process and when I hit submit order, it says that the order wasn‚Äôt able to complete. However, on quadpays end it says it was successful and I was charged my first installment. I contacted customer support and they told me that they weren‚Äôt able to refund me just yet, that it‚Äôd take 3-5 business days to see my money back. It is now going on a week and I haven‚Äôt seen anything. They did pause my installment for 7 days, but I‚Äôm worried I won‚Äôt get my money in time. 

For some dumb reason, I thought maybe it was a glitch for the website I went to originally. So I tried again, foolishly, to place another order at Walmart. They charged me the full price, and then my installment on TOP of that. 

Afterpay is so much better. Sure, there‚Äôs not as many options as quadpay but the process is a lot smoother and the 2 years I‚Äôve used it I‚Äôve never had any issues. 

Also the CEO of quadpay asked me to leave them a good review. Well, here‚Äôs a good, honest review. Thanks for nothing!

review: When I originally downloaded this app I signed up with a different phone number and was put on the waitlist and deleted the app. Fast forward I get an email that I‚Äôve been taken off the waitlist so I download the app and it automatically logs me in. I make a few purchases and go back to the app the next day and I‚Äôm logged out. This is when I realized I had my old phone number associated with my account. The website will allow you to login with your email but not the app and I‚Äôve been going back and forth with customer support for OVER A WEEK! Every time I try to update my phone number it says my current number is in use. They never reply, I‚Äôve had to go to their IG twice and comment just to get a response. Don‚Äôt bother stressing yourself out. It‚Äôs not worth the headache.
title: Do not download this app

review:
I started using QuadPay a few months ago and thought okay this is a convenient and easy way to shop and then I received the app and tried it out at the mall one day. Thank you for offering such a great way to shop and all the great new stores added as 90% of them are all my favs.

Kendra
title: Love this App & QuadPay

review: Quad pay it totally awesome and it‚Äôs so many stores I can use for purchasing. It‚Äôs a Great option for buy now and pay later when purchasing . I love it because it‚Äôs a great way to get great Gifts now without the hassle of exhausting all of my funds.. I love it !!!
title: Awesome Concept

review:
It worked fine for a while. Then my phone number changed. Whoooo boy. 

As far as I knew, I can log in with my email and change my number that way. Apparently not. I keep getting an error message. Tried another browser. Nope. Tried on my PC. Nada. Chatted in. Didn‚Äôt do crap for me. Submitted a ticket? Still waiting to hear back. Called their customer service? They can‚Äôt change my phone number, but can straight out provide my email over the phone if I ask. They can spam my email with frivolous emails every single day though. 

So they have no problem taking my money, but I can‚Äôt get in to see and make sure everything is being charged correctly. I‚Äôd rate higher, but their customer service is horrible and I can‚Äôt get into my account.
title: QuadPay will not let me log in.

review:
The title says it all. I found this app convenient at first, but after being charged for a cancelled transaction, I sent 3 emails, tried to get through on their chatline, searched high and low for a CS phone number (which can‚Äôt be found on their website/app... suspicious as heck), and even DM‚Äôd on twitter... and still no response. Yesterday i was charged 5 times for an order, but the app says i‚Äôve only made one payment... honestly, I understand mistakes happen, but Quadpay should have open communication with their customers instead of ghosting the people who make them money.
For anyone on the fence, go check out their twitter replies, its a sea of complaints- to which they respond with the same scripted tweet only to never resolve the situation at hand. Save yourself the hassle.
title: Beware of horrible CS & money theft

review: I have been using Klarna for a while now because it was the only Pay In 4 Installments company that allowed you to have a one time card that you could use anywhere, however lately I haven‚Äôt felt that I could rely on them. QuadPay now allows you to also create a one time card that can be used anywhere online BUT, unlike Klarna they allow you to see what your spending limit is so there aren‚Äôt any surprises. I‚Äôm really thankful for QuadPay, because right now I need a company I can rely on to help me through these hard times.

review: So my very first time using this app, I was shopping out of Walmart. However, Walmart does not have Apple Pay. I was upset considering I paid the $49 to QuadPay already. So I went into the QuadPay app and switched it to online purchase. It cancelled the whole order out, generated a new card number, then, it prompted me to pay again. I paid again. This time it was successful. However, it‚Äôs 2 months later and I‚Äôm still waiting on the refund from the initial order that was cancelled. And they have the nerve to keep texting me about a payment.. tuh, yeah right!! Credit the money you owe me to my payment Quadpay!!!

review: I found out about the app. I believe through the confirmation email. After I purchased from FN. review:

 Here‚Äôs how it works: A virtual credit card is generated for the amount you want and you‚Äôre debited for 25% of the cost then you‚Äôre billed every 14 days for an additional 25% until your balance is paid. I love this app! I can shop ANYWHERE and pay in four payments.
title: Love it!

review:

I needed to buy some groceries from Walmart to hold me over until my next paycheck and didn‚Äôt want to use my credit card. I stumbled upon this app and I was so excited! I gave it a chance and was super impressed. 4 monthly payments on here and no interest like credit cards. Totally worth it. The app is super easy to navigate and from what I‚Äôve found, you can use it for nearly everything. I will continue to use.
Thank you QuadPay!
title: Awesome App!!!!

review:
This app has honestly helped me a lot with money management . I am super grateful for it. It allows me to break purchases into smaller payments instead of just paying things at once, which hurts the pockets more . As a college student and someone who‚Äôs learning to manage their finances better, this sure makes it easier. Importantly, all while being interest fee.

I also like how it gives you a certain balance to help maintain discipline and not go crazy spending. Very easy sign up and start up process as well!
title: Highly recommend

review:
I can‚Äôt express the amount of appreciation I have for your company. I was laid off from my job in March 2020, and just recently became rehired in late September. Even with a savings account, I was behind in my bills which caused my credit to suffer. I exhausted my reserved funds to pay for basic necessities.

I finally caught up with bills (for the most part...) and then suddenly, it was November and time to Christmas shop for my kids. I cried for hours. How was I going to give my kids a decent Christmas? I had no money in savings and I was using most of my paychecks to catch up or pay bills.

I applied for a loan, and was denied. I applied for a credit card, denied.

Then I found Quadpay.

I was able to purchase some of their gifts and split the payments. Your company gave me a chance when no one else would. You helped me to give my kids Christmas, during a year where they needed Christmas the most.
title: COVID broke my spirits and QP repaired them.

review: I love that this app allows you to shop in store or online at pretty much every store you love. It helps to split your payment into four separate payments with zero fees. The app is user friendly, easy to use and your ghost card is applied straight to your Apple Pay so you don‚Äôt have to copy/ paste or type in anything which makes your purchase experience fast and efficient.
title: Great app!

review: I love QuadPay!!! It‚Äôs easy and convenient for me. I like not having to put my card info into different websites and that I can shop any store I choose. It‚Äôs a great idea. review:
Not to take anything away from using credit cards, BUT if you‚Äôre looking to get out of the credit card cycle of paying interest and carrying a balance, this is the way to go! 
You make your purchases at just about ANY store through QuadPay and they break your payment up for you into bite size chunks. You get your merchandise shipped out immediately, pay no interest, and pay it off in 4 payments that automatically come out of your account every two weeks. Easy, peasy! 
Love this new way to shop (and save)!üôåüèº

It would be helpful to have that option, but otherwise a great app and you can use it for just about any website! 
Wendy

My thoughts of the app is that it is a good option, but I think my limit is a bit low as I would like to shop for my entire family at once, and $200 isn‚Äôt buying very much at all.

review: This app is very easy to use. If the website you are buying from uses quad pay it‚Äôll break up the total including shipping into 4 easy payments. There is some apps that need to approve you for the funds before you can use it and often times they say no. Out of all the apps I‚Äôve used that does payments, this is by far the easiest!

The cool thing in the app is you can use it on ANY website, whether they list quadpay as a partner or not. I went and got a new phone case by using the app to get to the webpage, telling the app how much it would cost with S&H, and then copying the ‚Äòcredit card‚Äô info into the shopping cart.

review: Fantastic App! Where has this been!?! review:
Literally a scam. This has to be one of those apps that secretly take your information. If you don't know what I‚Äôm talking about look it up. It‚Äôs happening all the time, look at Facebook. 

The app let me get a ghost card once. I PAID ALL MY BALANCES AND IM STILL PAYING RIGHT NOW. 
Tried to make another purchase yesterday, but I was declined and managed to use 4 different cards and was consistently refused.
I even changed the store and lowered the amount to the bare minimum. I have good credit. The cards HAVE money in it. 

There should be no reason why i am not approved when they claim they dont check credit. I literally am following ALL of these requirements but they are so evil they wont even tell you what the guidelines are. It seems like you can only make one purchase and never return. 

The customer service is bad because they are already bad as a comapny for being so vague on how it works. they just gove you the general. like how are you gonna get people like this. I wouldnt even waste the time. The payments come every week and a half so if you dont have money like that to pay it off fast then its not for you.
title: Dont even waste your time. They dont care!

review:
This is one of the worse ‚Äúpayment plan‚Äù apps out there. I thought I would give it a try and made a purchase on FarFetch. The order did not go through because it there was an error with the payment. I was charged the first installment fee and have tried to reach out to get a refund since I‚Äôm not getting my order. There is no phone number or email you and send to someone. review:

review:
I would follow all the steps to use this app...select a merchant, provide the amount of the purchase, agree to the 4 payments, paid the first of the 4
payments, they would issue me a virtual Visa for the approved for amount & when I would go to use the card  it would be declined & I would get this message! 

‚ÄúQuadPay: A purchase was declined because there was no purchase request in the app. Please create a new purchase request in the app and try again.‚Äù 

Please note, that they are holding funds hostage in your bank account for the first payment, issuing you a useless card...& now you are stuck waiting for your money to be released back to you, since they bogus card they issued did not work! This happened several times before I stopped being in denial that it would work! Forget contacting support. Just as useless as the app. You know
The standard CSR living in India.
